009package imagingbook.common.geometry.moments;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
016
017/**
018 * This class defines static methods for moment calculations on 2D point sets.
019 * TODO: make more efficient versions!
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 *
023 */
024public abstract class Moments2D {
025        
026        public static double ordinaryMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
027                double mpq = 0.0;
028                if (p == 0 && q == 0) { // just count the number of points
029                        for (@SuppressWarnings("unused") Pnt2d pnt : R) {
030                                mpq += 1;
031                        }
032                }
033                else {
034                        for (Pnt2d pnt : R) {
035                                mpq += Math.pow(pnt.getX(), p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY(), q);
036                        }
037                }
038                return mpq;
039        }
040
041        public static double centralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
042                double m00 = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 0); // region area
043                if (Arithmetic.isZero(m00)) {
044                        throw new RuntimeException("empty point set");
045                }
046                double xc = ordinaryMoment(R, 1, 0) / m00;
047                double yc = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 1) / m00;
048                double mupq = 0.0;
049                for (Pnt2d pnt : R) {
050                        mupq += Math.pow(pnt.getX() - xc, p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY() - yc, q);
051                }
052                return mupq;
053        }
054
055        public static double normalizedCentralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
056                double m00 = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 0);
057                double scale = 1.0 / Math.pow(m00, 0.5 * (p + q) + 1);
058                return centralMoment(R, p, q) * scale;
059        }
060
061
062        public static void main(String[] args) {
063//              double s = 1.0;
064
065                List<Pnt2d> pts = new ArrayList<>();
066                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(10, 15));
067                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(3, 7));
068                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
069                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
070                
071//              Pnt2d[] points = pts.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
072//              System.out.println("set size = " + points.length);
073                Iterable<Pnt2d> points = pts;
074
075                System.out.println("Ordinary moments:");
076                System.out.println("m00 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0));
077                System.out.println("m10 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0));
078                System.out.println("m01 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1));
079                System.out.println("m11 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 1));
080                System.out.println("m20 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 2, 0));
081                System.out.println("m02 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 2));
082
083                double a = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0);
084                System.out.println("a = " + a);
085                System.out.println("xc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0) / a));
086                System.out.println("yc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1) / a));       
087
088                System.out.println("Central moments:");
089                System.out.println("mu10 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 0));
090                System.out.println("mu01 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 1));
091                System.out.println("mu11 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 1));
092                System.out.println("mu20 = " + centralMoment(points, 2, 0));
093                System.out.println("mu02 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 2));
094                
095                System.out.println("Normalized central moments:");
096                System.out.println("nu10 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 1, 0));
097                System.out.println("nu01 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 0, 1));
098                System.out.println("nu11 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 1, 1));
099                System.out.println("nu20 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 2, 0));
100                System.out.println("nu02 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 0, 2));
101        }
102
103}
104
105/*
106set size = 4
107m00 = 4.0
108m10 = 11.0
109m01 = 32.0
110a = 4.0
111xc = 2.75
112yc = 8.0
113mu10 = 0.0
114mu01 = 0.0
115mu11 = 73.0
116mu20 = 80.75
117mu02 = 68.0
118 */
